meanings.definition: A sweet spread made from fruit and sugar.
meanings.sent1: I love to spread jam on my toast in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The jam on the bread was delicious.
meanings.sent3: The jam jar rolled off the table and broke, creating a sticky mess.
meanings.sent4: The traffic was a jam of cars trying to get through the narrow street.
meanings.sent5: The jam oozed out of the sandwich, tempting everyone with its sweetness.

meanings.definition: To press or squeeze tightly between two surfaces.
meanings.sent1: She had to jam her clothes into the suitcase to make them fit.
meanings.sent2: He accidentally jammed his finger in the door.
meanings.sent3: The door wouldn't open because someone tried to jam a shoe in the gap.
meanings.sent4: The gears jammed, causing the machine to stop suddenly.
meanings.sent5: He tried to jam the last piece of the puzzle into place.

meanings.definition: A situation in which movement is impeded or blocked.
meanings.sent1: The traffic jam lasted for hours due to the accident.
meanings.sent2: We were stuck in a jam on the highway.
meanings.sent3: The jam of people at the entrance made it hard to get inside.
meanings.sent4: The jam in the hallway cleared up once the event ended.
meanings.sent5: The jam of boxes in the doorway made it impossible to enter the room.
